page.title: 05ECOLOGY WIDEWATER LANCING SX
page.content: The Widewater is an area of brackish water that lies between the beach and the sea.The Widewaters area is 7.5 hectares.It is a shallow lagoon,depth one metre.The water is fresh and the bottom is soft mud.In summer it's covered in algae.The earliest date recorded was 1085.It used to cover Shorham airport,Old & New Salts Farm & Monks Farm.The second date recorded was 1250.In 1622 a stream flowed from Sompting and another from the west to join the River Adur.By 1700 no rivers or streams flowed,and storms at sea moved weed,shingle & mud into a bank. This bank exists today,but has been artificially improved to prevent floding.The sea has flowed over the bank twice in recent years.This has caused large quantities of shingle in the area.The Widewater in Lancing has a lot of wildlife & vegetation.
